FuncDef: The save ap-id command saves a specified AP's configurations on a master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ID for an AP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Examples: Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...............done.
Info: Succeeded in saving the configurations on AP 2000.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To save a specified AP's configurations, run the save ap-id command on a master.
Prerequisites
An AP has sufficient disk space for configuration file saving.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
After the save ap-id command is run, configuration files are generated in the specified AP's configuration file directory.
